rows.S41: INSTITUTIONAL STRATEGY: How to go from cold email to published case study with institutional affiliation.

rows.col_2: Email exchange. They review your work. You cite them. They cite you.
rows.col_4: Send email. Share Trade. They find it interesting. You exchange ideas.

rows.col_2: They formally acknowledge you as contributing data to their research.
rows.col_4: They include your case study in a paper. You're in the acknowledgments or co-author.

rows.col_2: Formal letter from institution. You're listed on their lab page.
rows.col_4: They sponsor you as an external affiliate. Usually requires ongoing collaboration.

rows.col_2: You sit on their advisory board (or they sit on yours).
rows.col_4: Mutual value exchange. They advise you, you provide data.

rows.col_2: Joint research proposal to NSF, DARPA, or similar.
rows.col_4: They write a grant with you as industry partner providing the testbed.

rows.S41: INSTITUTIONAL STRATEGY: TIMELINE: COLD EMAIL TO PUBLISHED CASE STUDY

rows.col_2: Send personalized emails to Priority 1 targets (Valentine/Bernstein, Nagpal)
Share Trade documentation + research design draft with interested researchers
rows.col_3: Get feedback on research design. Confirm mutual interest.

rows.col_2: Agree on collaboration terms (informal to start)
rows.col_3: Email confirmation: "Yes, I'd like to collaborate on this case study"

rows.col_2: Production cycle runs. Data collected passively.
rows.col_3: Researcher receives periodic updates. Maybe one check-in call.
Researcher reviews data. Confirms it's publishable.

rows.col_2: Present at conferences. Cite each other. Explore deeper collaboration.
rows.col_3: Relationship deepens. Upgrade from Level 1 to Level 2-3.
Top HCI venue. Flash teams + AI co-pilot angle.
Top management journal. Novel organizational form.
Practitioner audience. "The Flash Team Venture Studio."
If co-authored with Couzin or Levin. High prestige.
Niche but exactly on topic. If co-authored with Nagpal/Dorigo.
